page.title: 02VISIT TO GORSE BANK FARM
page.content:
The farm covers 650 acres on which there are 10 buildings. There are 63 fields and moorland. Crops grown include kale, potatoes, wheat, barley and oats. Pasture covers 350 acres. The farmer rears large white pigs; Ayrshire and Fresian dairy cattle; Angus, Hereford and Limousan beef cattle; Suffolk, Wensleydale and Texel sheep. There are also 3 collies.
Tractors pull trailers for transporting crops and animal feed. They also pull machines for ploughing, hoeing, harrowing and drilling. The farmer uses combine harvesters for harvesting the corn.
